perturbation.original_text: 1.1  Subject to the provisions of this Agreement, Airspan hereby appoints Distributor as an independent, exclusive distributor to assist Airspan in marketing the Airspan Products to customers in the Territory, and Distributor hereby accepts such appointment as of the Effective Date of this Agreement. Distributor's appointment as a distributor of the Airspan Products grants to Distributor only a license to resell the
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1  Subject to the provisions of this Agreement, Airspan hereby appoints Distributor as an independent, non-exclusive distributor to assist Airspan in marketing the Airspan Products to customers in the Territory, and Distributor hereby accepts such appointment as of the Effective Date of this Agreement. Distributor's appointment as a distributor of the Airspan Products grants to Distributor only a license to resell the
perturbation.explanation: The original text states the distributor is an 'exclusive distributor.' The changed text modifies this to 'non-exclusive distributor.' This creates a contradiction if the Schedule II or any other part of the agreement stipulates that the distribution rights are exclusive, or if later sections refer to the 'exclusive' nature of the distributorship, thus leading to uncertainty regarding the scope of the distribution rights.

perturbation.original_text: 3.7  Distributor agrees to provide to its customers' installation services for all Airspan Products.  All such installation services shall be performed by Distributor in accordance with Airspan's latest installation standards as provided by Airspan.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.7  Distributor may provide to its customers' installation services for all Airspan Products. All such installation services may be performed by Distributor in accordance with Distributor's own installation standards.
perturbation.explanation: The original text mandates that the Distributor 'agrees to provide' installation services and 'shall be performed' according to Airspan's standards, creating an obligation. The changed text alters 'agrees to provide' to 'may provide,' making the service optional. Furthermore, it changes 'shall be performed' to 'may be performed' in accordance with 'Distributor's own installation standards,' which gives it flexibility to deviate from Airspan's standards. If other parts of the agreement assume that installation services are mandatory and must meet Airspan's standards, this creates a contradiction and ambiguity.

perturbation.original_text: 14.2 Subject to Sections 14.3 and 14.4, Airspan warrants that the Equipment sold to Distributor under this Agreement shall, under normal use and service, be free from defects in materials and faulty workmanship, and that the Software licensed to Distributor under this Agreement shall conform in all material respects to Airspan's published specifications therefor. The warranty period for any item of Equipment and related Software shall be twelve (12) months from the date of delivery of such Equipment and related Software to Distributor as set forth in Paragraph 8.1 (hereinafter, this period of time shall be referred to as the "Initial Warranty Period.")
perturbation.changed_text: 14.2 Subject to Sections 14.3 and 14.4, Airspan warrants that the Equipment sold to Distributor under this Agreement shall, under normal use and service, be free from defects in materials and faulty workmanship. The warranty period for any item of Equipment shall be six (6) months from the date of delivery of such Equipment to Distributor as set forth in Paragraph 8.1 (hereinafter, this period of time shall be referred to as the "Initial Warranty Period.")
perturbation.explanation: In the original contract, the warranty covered both Equipment and Software and lasted for twelve months. The changed version removes the warranty for the software altogether and reduces the warranty period for the Equipment to six months. This creates an ambiguity if the other sections of the contract refer to the Initial Warranty Period as twelve months for both Equipment and Software, particularly regarding support and maintenance responsibilities or extended warranty options.
